results.title: Ronald Reagan
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
From small town boy to President of the United States, Ronald Reagan never forgot the teachings of his mother’s Christian Church and its vision of America as God’s chosen country. He took the world to the brink of nuclear war, and then came close to abolishing the entire nuclear arsenal of the United States and the Soviet Union. Features rare and exclusive footage. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Saddam Hussein: the godfather of Iraq
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
Born in 1937 into poverty and a fatherless home, Saddam Hussein was raised by his military uncle who fought against the British, instilling in his nephew a fierce nationalism, especially for Tsuni Arabs. Following a period of exile in Nassar, Hussein returns to Iraq, marries, and assumes a number of key positions in the governing Bath party. His penchant for violent political tactics appears early in his career, as he ruthlessly sets about destroying non Tsuni’s to secure a Bath party majority. His ability for self preservation and fierce nationalism also shows through as he publicly decries Europe and Russia while secretly carrying out deals with them. The 8 year war between Iran and Iraq is covered, as well as the ensuing war with Kuwait as Iraq is left financially bankrupt and geographically desolate after the war. The war against Kuwait would cease thanks to Operation Desert Storm, but with a high cost to civilian casualties. Regardless of the polarisation between those who view him as villain or hero, this documentary effectively conveys a leader who is, above all else, a ruthless survivor. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Lech Walesa
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
Lech Walesa, the fly, feisty, mustachioed electrician from Gdansk, shaped the 20th century as the leader of the Solidarity movement that led the Poles out of communism. It is one of history’s great ironies that the nearest thing we have ever seen to a genuine workers’ revolution was directed against a so-called workers’ state. Poland was again the icebreaker for the rest of Central Europe in the “velvet revolutions” of 1989. Walesa’s contribution to the end of communism in Europe, and hence the end of the cold war, stands beside those of his fellow Pole, Pope John Paul II, and the Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Jimmy Stewart
results.creator_credit: Del Jack, Cress Darwin and Millenial Entertainment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
This is the story of the life and career of James Stewart. Born on May 20, 1908 in Indiana, Pennsylvania, Jimmy Stewart embodied America’s idea of itself in a career spanning more than 75 often extraordinary films. Nominated for five Academy awards during his lifetime, winning Best Actor for “The Philadelphia Story” (1940), Stewart came to acting after graduating from Princeton University in 1932 with a degree in architecture. He died on July 2, 1997.

results.title: Delilah
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Famous women of the past”
Aided by the art of famous painters, this documentary tells the tail of Delilah, the biblical character, outcast and lover of Samson. Victim of savage gossip, she is burnt to death by Samson’s jealous Philistines.

results.title: The Queen of Sheba
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Strange and dramatic pages from the lives of the world’s most famous women. The Queen of Sheba having heard of King Solomon’s wisdom, travels across the desert to Jerusalem to meet him. The journey is one of the greatest overland journeys in history. On her arrival, the King greets her with majestic splendour, cordiality and hospitality. After a six-month stay, the Queen decides to return home. Following a sumptuous banquet in her honour, King Solomon tricks the Queen and satisfies his lust for this woman of great beauty and deep intelligence. The Queen of Sheba returns home and gives birth to a son. King Soloman never sees the Queen again but does finally meet his 16 yeaer old son, who later becomes the King of Abyssinia.

results.title: Costa Rica
results.creator_credit: Rolando Quiros, Horst Cerns, UNICEF and Japanese TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Families of the world”.
Captures the flavour of life on a Costa Rican coffee plantation during harvest time when the whole family helps. At harvest’s end the family joins the village fiesta, parading by day and revelling by night.
